Package pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1

Class MainServer

java.lang.Object
pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.MainServer
public class MainServer extends Object
MainServer class to handle the communication between clients and the server using Java NIO. It listens for client connections, manages game states, and processes commands from clients. The server supports multiple games and players, facilitating interaction via socket communication.

    • PORT

      public static final int PORT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • MainServer

      public MainServer()
      Constructor for MainServer class. This constructor is intentionally left empty. Initialization is handled in the run() method.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main entry point for the server application. This method starts the server by initializing required components and then entering the server's main loop.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used in this implementation).

    • run

      public void run()
      Initializes and runs the server. It sets up the server socket channel, binds it to the port, and starts listening for incoming client connections. The method also processes incoming commands and communicates with clients based on the game state.

    • handleAccept

      public void handleAccept(SelectionKey key) throws IOException
      Handles the acceptance of a new client connection. This method is called when a new client attempts to connect to the server. The connection is established, and the client is registered for read operations in the NIO selector.
      Parameters:
      key - The SelectionKey associated with the ServerSocketChannel, which indicates that the channel is ready to accept a new client connection.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while accepting the client connection.

    • handleRead

      public void handleRead(SelectionKey key, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Handles reading data from a connected client. This method is called when the server is ready to read incoming data from a client. It reads the data into a buffer, processes the message, and optionally sends a response back to the client.
      Parameters:
      key - The SelectionKey associated with the client channel, indicating that it is ready for reading.
      buffer - The ByteBuffer used for reading the data from the client channel.

    • disconnectClient

      public void disconnectClient(SocketChannel clientChannel)
      Disconnects a client from the server. This method is called when a client disconnects, either intentionally or due to an error. It removes the client from the game, cleans up associated data, and closes the client channel.
      Parameters:
      clientChannel - The SocketChannel representing the client to be disconnected.

    • handleMessage

      public String handleMessage(String message, SocketChannel sc)
      Handles an incoming message from a client, processes the command, and returns an appropriate response. This method interprets the message, validates the command, and routes the request to the appropriate handler based on the command type (e.g., CREATE, JOIN, READY, FOLD, etc.). Commands that can be handled: - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID CREATE : Creates a new game. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID JOIN amount : Joins an existing game. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID READY : Marks the player as ready to play. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID FOLD : The player folds the hand. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID CALL : The player calls the current bet. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID CHECK : The player checks (does not raise or fold). - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID RAISE raiseValue : The player raises the current bet by a specified value. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID EXCHANGE 2,3 : The player exchanges specified cards. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID STATUS : The player requests the current game status. - GAME_ID PLAYER_ID LEAVE : The player leaves the game.
      Parameters:
      message - The command message sent by the client, which includes the game ID, player ID, and the command.
      sc - The SocketChannel representing the connection to the client.
      Returns:
      A response message based on the command. If the command is invalid or an error occurs, an error message is returned.

    • parseIndexesIfNeeded

      public List<Integer> parseIndexesIfNeeded(String[] tokens)
      Parses the card exchange indexes from the command if provided. This method processes a comma-separated string of card indexes and checks for validity. It ensures that all indexes are integers within the valid range of [0-4], as only 5 cards can be exchanged in a poker hand.
      Parameters:
      tokens - The command split into tokens, where the third token is expected to be "EXCHANGE" and the fourth token contains the card indexes.
      Returns:
      A list of valid card indexes (integers) that the player wants to exchange.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided card indexes are invalid, out of range, or in an incorrect format.

    • handleCreateGame

      public String handleCreateGame(String gameId)
      Handles the creation of a new game. This method checks if a game with the given game ID already exists. If not, it creates a new game and adds it to the list of active games.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The ID of the game to be created.
      Returns:
      A message indicating whether the game was successfully created or if a game with the same ID already exists.

    • handleJoin

      public String handleJoin(Game game, String playerId, String[] tokens, SocketChannel sc)
      Handles the "JOIN" command, where a player joins an existing game by providing their player ID and an initial betting amount. The method verifies if the game is in a valid state to accept new players and if the provided betting amount is valid.
      Parameters:
      game - The game the player is attempting to join.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player.
      tokens - The command tokens split by space, where the fourth token is expected to be the amount.
      sc - The SocketChannel representing the connection with the client.
      Returns:
      A response string indicating the result of the "JOIN" command, including any errors or success messages.

    • handleReady

      public String handleReady(Game game, String playerId)
      Handles the "READY" command, marking the player as ready for the game to start. If all players are marked as ready, the game will notify the players to start.
      Parameters:
      game - The game the player is interacting with.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player.
      Returns:
      A response string indicating the result of the "READY" command, including player status.

    • handleCards

      public String handleCards(Game game, String playerId)
      Handles the "CARDS" command, retrieving and displaying the player's current hand in the game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game the player is interacting with.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player.
      Returns:
      A string representing the player's hand in the game, or an error message if there is an issue.

    • handleStatus

      public String handleStatus(Game game, String playerId)
      Handles the "STATUS" command, which provides the current state of the game, including the game ID, the current state of the game (e.g., waiting for players, in progress), the current player, the blinds, and the pot amount.
      Parameters:
      game - The game whose status is being requested.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player requesting the status.
      Returns:
      A string containing the current status of the game, or an error message if an exception occurs.

    • handleFold

      public String handleFold(Game game, String playerId)
      Handles the "FOLD" command, allowing a player to fold (quit the current round) during a betting round. The player can only fold if the game is in one of the betting rounds (either first or second betting round). If the last player folds, the game is concluded.
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which the player is folding.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player who is folding.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the result of the fold action, or an error message if the fold is not allowed.

    • handleLeave

      public String handleLeave(String gameId, String playerId)
      Handles the "LEAVE" command, allowing a player to leave a game. The player is removed from the game, and their status is updated accordingly.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The ID of the game the player is leaving.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player leaving the game.
      Returns:
      A string indicating that the player has left the game.

    • handleCall

      public String handleCall(Game game, String playerId, SocketChannel sc)
      Handles the "CALL" command, where a player matches the current bet in the round. The method checks if the player is authorized to make the call and updates the game state accordingly.
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which the player is calling.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player making the call.
      sc - The SocketChannel representing the connection with the player.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the result of the call action, or an error message if the call is not valid.

    • handleRaise

      public String handleRaise(Game game, String playerId, String[] tokens, SocketChannel sc)
      Handles the "RAISE" command, allowing a player to increase their current bet during a betting round. The player can only raise the bet if they are authorized and the amount is valid. After raising, the game state is updated and the round is processed if necessary.
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which the raise action is taking place.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player raising the bet.
      tokens - The array of tokens split from the player's message, containing the raise amount.
      sc - The socket channel representing the player making the raise.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the result of the raise action, or an error message if the raise is not allowed.

    • handleCheck

      public String handleCheck(Game game, String playerId, SocketChannel sc)
      Handles the "CHECK" command, allowing a player to check (i.e., pass their turn without betting) during a betting round. The player can only check if they are authorized and the game state allows it. After checking, the game state is updated and the round is processed if necessary.
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which the check action is taking place.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player checking the bet.
      sc - The socket channel representing the player making the check.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the result of the check action, or an error message if the check is not allowed.

    • handleExchange

      public String handleExchange(Game game, String playerId, List<Integer> indexes, SocketChannel sc)
      Handles the "EXCHANGE" command, allowing a player to exchange a certain number of their cards. The player must provide valid card indexes and can exchange up to 4 cards. The player can only exchange cards if they are authorized, and the game allows the exchange. If the player has folded, the exchange will still proceed, but the folded status will be noted.
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which the exchange action is taking place.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player requesting the card exchange.
      indexes - A list of card indexes to be exchanged.
      sc - The socket channel representing the player making the exchange request.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the result of the exchange action, including the player's new hand, or an error message if the exchange is not allowed.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(SocketChannel clientChannel, String message)
      Sends a message to the specified client over the given SocketChannel. The message is first trimmed and encoded in UTF-8 before being sent.
      Parameters:
      clientChannel - The SocketChannel to which the message will be sent.
      message - The message to be sent to the client.

    • notifyGameStateToPlayers

      public void notifyGameStateToPlayers(Game game)
      Notifies all players in the game about the current game state. This includes information about the game ID, current state, current player, pot, and betting round contributions. The information is sent to each player via their corresponding SocketChannel.
      Parameters:
      game - The game whose state is being notified to players.

    • notifyGameStartToPlayers

      public void notifyGameStartToPlayers(Game game)
      Notifies all players about the start of the game. This includes information about the game ID, small blind, big blind, current player, phase, pot, and each player's hand. The information is sent to each player via their corresponding SocketChannel.
      Parameters:
      game - The game that has started.

    • notifyPlayerExchange

      public void notifyPlayerExchange(Game game, String playerId)
      Notifies all players about a specific player's card exchange action. This includes the player ID and the game ID, notifying everyone that the player has finished exchanging cards. The information is sent to each player via their corresponding SocketChannel.
      Parameters:
      game - The game where the exchange occurred.
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player who exchanged their cards.

    • notifyPlayerExchangeIfFolded

      public void notifyPlayerExchangeIfFolded(Game game, String playerId)
      Notifies all players that a specific player has skipped their turn because they have folded. This notification includes game details such as the current game ID, the current player, the game state, and the pot. The message is sent to each player's SocketChannel.
      Parameters:
      game - The game whose status is being notified.
      playerId - The player who folded and skipped their turn.

    • notifyBettingRoundFinished

      public void notifyBettingRoundFinished(Game game)
      Notifies all players that a betting round has finished. The message depends on the current game state, and can indicate the conclusion of the first betting round, the second betting round, or a game-over situation where a winner is determined.
      Parameters:
      game - The game whose betting round is being notified.

    • resetGameOnServer

      public void resetGameOnServer(Game game)
      Resets the state of the game on the server when the game is over. This includes clearing the game's players, resetting the game state, and removing the game from the server's game map.
      Parameters:
      game - The game to be reset on the server.

    • handleGameOver

      public void handleGameOver(Game game)
      Handles the game over scenario by notifying all players that the betting round has finished, and then resetting the game state for the next round or session.
      Parameters:
      game - The game that is over and needs to be reset.

    • handleLastPlayerStanding

      public void handleLastPlayerStanding(Game game)
      Handles the case where there is only one player remaining in the game. It declares that player as the winner, sends a message to all players, and resets the game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game where the last player is standing.

    • isPlayerAuthorized

      public boolean isPlayerAuthorized(String playerId, SocketChannel sc)
      Checks if a player is authorized to perform actions in the game based on their socket channel. The player is authorized if their player ID is associated with the provided socket channel.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The player ID to be checked.
      sc - The socket channel of the player.
      Returns:
      true if the player is authorized to act, false otherwise.

    • removePlayerFromGame

      public void removePlayerFromGame(String gameId, String playerId)
      Removes a player from a game by their player ID. If the game has no more players, it will be removed from the active games.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The ID of the game from which the player should be removed.
      playerId - The ID of the player to be removed.

    • sendHandPlayers

      public void sendHandPlayers(Game game)
      Sends each player's hand (cards) and the current pot value to all players in the game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game instance containing the players and the current game state.

    • notifyAllPlayers

      public void notifyAllPlayers(Game game, String message)
      Sends a message to all players in the game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game instance containing all players.
      message - The message to be sent to all players.

    • setSelector

      public void setSelector(Selector selector)
      Sets the selector for handling non-blocking I/O operations.
      Parameters:
      selector - The selector to be set.

    • getSelector

      public Selector getSelector()
      Gets the current selector used for non-blocking I/O operations.
      Returns:
      The selector instance being used.

    • getServerChannel

      public ServerSocketChannel getServerChannel()
      Gets the server socket channel used for accepting client connections.
      Returns:
      The server socket channel instance.

    • setServerChannel

      public void setServerChannel(ServerSocketChannel serverChannel)
      Sets the server socket channel used for accepting client connections.
      Parameters:
      serverChannel - The server socket channel to be set.

    • getGames

      public Map<String,Game> getGames()
      Gets the map of games currently managed by the server.
      Returns:
      The map of games, where the key is the game ID and the value is the game instance.

    • setGames

      public void setGames(Map<String,Game> games)
      Sets the map of games managed by the server.
      Parameters:
      games - The map of games to be set, where the key is the game ID and the value is the game instance.

    • getClientGameMap

      public Map<String,SocketChannel> getClientGameMap()
      Gets the map of client channels mapped to player IDs.
      Returns:
      The map of client channels, where the key is the player ID and the value is the corresponding client channel.

    • setClientGameMap

      public void setClientGameMap(Map<String,SocketChannel> clientGameMap)
      Sets the map of client channels mapped to player IDs.
      Parameters:
      clientGameMap - The map of client channels to be set, where the key is the player ID and the value is the corresponding client channel.

    • shutdownServer

      public static void shutdownServer()
      Initiates server shutdown.
